TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TextElementAutomationPeer extends System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentTextAutomationPeer

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Documents.TextElement owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Rect GetBoundingRectangleCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the <xref:System.Windows.Rect> representing the bounding rectangle of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer>. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle%2A>.
Docs.returns: The <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that contains the coordinates of the element, or <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Empty%2A> if the element is not a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> and a <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> GetChildrenCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of child elements of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer>. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer> provides access to its content through <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>, this method always returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a <xref:System.Windows.Point> that represents the clickable space that is on the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer>. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint%2A>.
Docs.returns: The <xref:System.Windows.Point> on the element that allows a click. The point values are (<xref:System.Double.NaN>, <xref:System.Double.NaN>) if the element is not a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> and a <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsOffscreenCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer> is off of the screen. Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen%2A>.
Docs.returns: `true` if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, the element can be on the screen but still not be visible. An example is an element that is obscured by other elements.
